CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 5, 1958, pg. A4 reads: "Meeting The Candidates -Democratic voters and workers of the Fifth District of the Fifh [sic] Ward arranged a "get-acquainted" session last Friday which gave them an opportunity to meet and chat with the two candidates for the State Legislature, Attys. James F. Clarke (fourth from right) and K. Leroy Irvis (far right). Others in the picture are (left to right) Clarence Young, Ted Brown, candidate for district committee; Mrs. Clarence Young, Mr. Clarke, Mac Simpson, Mrs. Thelma Lovett, candidate for district committee, and Mr. Irvis.  This meeting opened the campaign for the two legislative candidates. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left: Clarence Young, Ted Brown, Mrs. Clarence Young, James F. Clarke, Mac Simpson, Thelma Lovette, and K. Leroy Irvis, gathered in domestic interior with round beveled mirror, another version
